element.name: olfactory nerves
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/olfactory.htm OLFACTORY NERVE]; first cranial nerve, I
element.origin: the nerves of smell, consisting of about 20 bundles which arise in the OLFACTORY EPITHELIUM
element.distribution: pass through the cribriform plate of the ethmoid bone to the olfactory bulb

element.name: optic nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne125.htm OPTIC NERVE]; second cranial nerve, II, nerve of sight
element.origin: actually part of the central nervous system throughout its course; it consists chiefly of axons and central processes of cells of the ganglionic layer of the RETINA
element.distribution: leave the orbit through the optic canal, and joins with its opposite number to form the optic chiasm (the medial fibers of each nerve crossing over to the opposite side), then continues as the optic tract to end in the lateral geniculate body

element.name: trigeminal nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne128.htm TRIGEMINAL NERVE]; fifth cranial nerve, V
element.origin: emerges from the lateral surface of the pons as a MOTOR and a SENSORY ROOT, together with some intermediate fibers, fine touch to principal, crude touch and pain to spinal
element.distribution: The sensory root expands into the trigeminal ganglion, which contains the cells of origin of most of the sensory fibers, and from which the three divisions of the nerve arise
element.modality: The trigeminal nerve is sensory in supplying the face, teeth, mouth, and nasal cavity, and motor in supplying the muscles of mastication

element.name: mandibular nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne156.htm MANDIBULAR NERVE]; one of three terminal divisions of the trigeminal nerve
element.origin: trigeminal GANGLION
element.distribution: passing through the foramen ovale to the infratemporal fossa, extensive distribution to muscles of mastication, skin of face, mucous membrane of mouth, and teeth

element.name: buccal nerve
element.origin: mandibular nerve
element.distribution: skin and mucous membrane of cheeks, gums, and perhaps the first two molars and the premolars

element.name: masseteric nerve
element.origin: mandibular division of trigeminal nerve
element.distribution: masseter muscle and temporomandibular joint, proprioception

element.name: temporal nerves, deep
element.origin: usually two in number, anterior and posterior, with a third middle one often seen, mandibular nerve
element.distribution: temporal muscles

element.name: pterygoid nerve, lateral
element.origin: mandibular nerve
element.distribution: lateral pterygoid muscle

element.name: auriculotemporal nerve
element.origin: by two roots from the mandibular nerve
element.distribution: parotid gland, scalp in temporal region, tympanic membrane

element.name: auricular nerves, anterior
element.origin: auriculotemporal nerve
element.distribution: supply the tragus and upper part of the auricle, skin of anterosuperior part of external ear

element.name: nerve of external acoustic meatus
element.origin: auriculotemporal nerve
element.distribution: skin lining external acoustic meatus, and tympanic membrane

element.name: auriculotemporal nerve, parotid branch
element.origin: auriculotemporal nerve passes medially to the neck of the mandible, gives off parotid branches and then turns superior
element.distribution: secretomotor fibers from tympanic plexus to the parotid gland

element.name: auriculotemporal nerve, branch to tympanic membrane
element.origin: auriculotemporal nerve comprises exclusively somatosensory fibers, which ascend to the superficial temporal region and there it supplies the supplies the auricle, external acoustic meatus, outer side of the tympanic membrane and the skin in the temporal region
element.distribution: outer side of the tympanic membrane and the skin in the temporal region

element.name: auriculotemporal nerve, branches communicating with facial nerve
element.origin: The auriculotemporal nerve then pierces the parotid fascia and enters the retromandibular region of the parotid gland; Within the parotid gland, it breaks up in a spray of branches that immediately and abruptly diverge; Anterior and posterior communicating ramus with the facial nerve
element.distribution: They provide sensory fibers for the zygomatic, buccal, and mandibular divisions of the facial nerve to the skin, convey proprioceptive impulses from orbicularis oculi

element.name: inferior alveolar nerve
element.origin: mandibular nerve
element.distribution: teeth and gums of lower jaw, skin of chin and lower lip, mylohyoid muscle and anterior belly of digastric muscle

element.name: inferior alveolar nerve, dental branches
element.origin: Within the canal or in their intraosseous course the fascicles of the IAN can either unite into single or double stranded bundles as well as ramify into an ample plexus formation. These neural structures give rise to the inferior dental branches and the inferior gingival branches
element.distribution: providing sensation to the teeth and gums

element.name: inferior alveolar nerve, gingival branches
element.origin: see dental branches
element.distribution: mandibular (lower jaw) gingiva, interteeth tissue

element.name: mental nerve
element.origin: inferior alveolar nerve
element.distribution: skin of chin, and lower lip

element.name: mylohyoid nerve
element.origin: inferior alveolar nerve
element.distribution: mylohyoid muscle, anterior belly of digastric muscle

element.name: lingual nerve
element.origin: mandibular nerve
element.distribution: descending to the tongue, first medial to the mandible and then under cover of the mucous membrane of the mouth; anterior two-thirds of tongue, adjacent areas of mouth, gums, isthmus of fauces

element.name: lingual nerve, branch to isthmus of fauces
element.distribution: conveying general sensation from the oral mucosa between the oral cavity and oropharynx

element.name: lingual nerve, lingual branch
element.distribution: innervate mandibular lingual gingiva

element.name: sublingual nerve
element.origin: lingual nerve
element.distribution: visceral efferent (secretomotor) fibers to the submandibular and sublingual salivary glands and overlying mucous membrane; a branch of the lingual nerve supplying parasympathetic fibers to the sublingual gland and sensory fibers to the mucous membrane of the floor of the mouth

element.name: mandibular nerve, meningeal branch
element.distribution: supplies the dura mater, supplies mastoid cells that communicate with middle ear

element.name: pterygoid nerve, medial
element.origin: mandibular nerve
element.distribution: medial pterygoid, tensor tympani, and tensor veli palatini muscles

element.name: nerve to tensor tympani
element.origin: mandibular nerve via nerve to medial pterygoid MUSCLE and otic GANGLION
element.distribution: tensor tympani muscle

element.name: nerve to tensor veli palatini
element.origin: mandibular nerve via nerve to medial pterygoid MUSCLE and otic GANGLION
element.distribution: tensor veli palatini muscle

element.name: maxillary nerve
element.origin: one of the three terminal divisions of the trigeminal nerve, passing through the foramen rotundum, and entering the pterygopalatine fossa, from trigeminal GANGLION
element.distribution: extensive distribution to skin of face and scalp, mucous membrane of maxillary sinus and nasal cavity, and teeth

element.name: alveolar nerves, superior, posterior branch
element.origin: arise from the maxillary nerve
element.distribution: innervate the teeth of the upper jaw and the maxillary sinus, and forming the superior dental plexus, molars

element.name: branches of the pterygopalatine ganglion, sensory fibers
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne142.htm GANGLIONIC BRANCHES OF MAXILLARY NERVE],[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne153.htm PTERYGOPALATINE GANGLION]
element.distribution: Eye, lacrimal gland; Nose, nasal gland; Mouth, mucosal glands of palate and pharynx

element.name: nasopalatine nerve, sensory fibers
element.origin: pterygopalatine GANGLION
element.distribution: carries sensory information from the posterior inferior medial wall of the nasal cavity and anterior hard palate

element.name: palatine nerve, greater, sensory fibers
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne226.htm GREATER PALATINE NERVE]; palatine nerve, sensory fibers, anterior
element.origin: pterygopalatine GANGLION
element.distribution: emerges through the greater palatine foramen and supplies the palate

element.name: palatine nerves, lesser, sensory fibers
element.origin: pterygopalatine GANGLION
element.distribution: emerge through the lesser palatine foramen and supply the soft palate and tonsil, uvula

element.name: infraorbital nerve
element.origin: continuation of the maxillary nerve, entering the orbit through the inferior orbital fissure, and occupying in succession the infraorbital groove, canal, and foramen
element.distribution: incisor, cuspid, and premolar teeth of upper jaw, skin and conjunctiva of lower eyelid, mobile septum and skin of side of nose, mucous membrane of mouth, skin of upper lip

element.name: alveolar nerves, superior, anterior and middle branches
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne147.htm MIDDLE SUPERIOR ALVEOLAR NERVE],[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne148.htm ANTERIOR SUPERIOR ALVEOLAR NERVE]; nasodental ramus
element.origin: arise from infraorbital nerves
element.distribution: innervate the teeth of the upper jaw and the maxillary sinus, and forming the superior dental plexus, incisors (anterior), premolars (middle)

element.name: infraorbital nerve, external nasal branch
element.distribution: nasal alae, inferior and lateral aspects of the nose

element.name: infraorbital nerve, inferior palpebral branch
element.distribution: supply the skin and conjunctiva of the lower eyelid, joining at the lateral angle of the orbit with the facial and zygomaticofacial nerves

element.name: internal nasal nerve
element.distribution: supply the septum, pass to skin of nasal vestibule

element.name: superior labial branch
element.distribution: skin of the upper lip

element.name: maxillary nerve, meningeal branch
element.origin: maxillary nerve directly after its origin from the semilunar ganglion, before enters the foramen rotundum
element.distribution: supplies the dura mater

element.name: zygomatic nerve
element.origin: maxillary nerve, entering the orbit through the inferior orbital fissure
element.distribution: communicates with the lacrimal nerve and supplies the skin of the temple and adjacent part of the face

element.name: ophthalmic nerve
element.origin: one of the three terminal divisions of the trigeminal nerve, trigeminal GANGLION
element.distribution: eyeball and conjunctiva, lacrimal gland and sac, nasal mucosa and frontal sinus, external nose, upper eyelid, forehead, and scalp

element.name: frontal nerve
element.origin: ophthalmic division of trigeminal nerve; enters the orbit through the superior orbital fissure
element.distribution: chiefly to the forehead and scalp, sensory innervations for the skin of the forehead, mucosa of frontal sinus, and the skin of the upper eyelid

element.name: supraorbital nerve
element.origin: continuation of frontal nerve, from ophthalmic nerve
element.distribution: leaves orbit through supraorbital notch or foramen, and supplies the skin of upper eyelid, forehead, anterior scalp (to vertex), mucosa of frontal sinus

element.name: supratrochlear nerve
element.origin: frontal nerve, from ophthalmic nerve
element.distribution: leaves orbit at medial end of supraorbital margin and supplies the forehead and upper eyelid

element.name: lacrimal nerve
element.origin: ophthalmic division of trigeminal nerve, entering the orbit through the superior orbital fissure
element.distribution: lacrimal gland, conjunctiva, lateral commissure of eye, and skin of upper eyelid; MODALITY={general sensory

element.name: nasociliary nerve
element.origin: ophthalmic division of trigeminal nerve

element.name: ciliary nerves, long, sensory fibers
element.origin: nasociliary nerve, from ophthalmic nerve
element.distribution: dilator muscle of pupil, uvea, cornea

element.name: ciliary nerves, short, sensory fibers
element.origin: ciliary GANGLION
element.distribution: smooth muscle and tunics of eye

element.name: ethmoidal nerve, anterior
element.origin: continuation of nasociliary nerve, from ophthalmic nerve
element.distribution: mucosa of upper and anterior nasal septum, lateral wall of nasal cavity, skin of lower bridge and tip of nose

element.name: ethmoidal nerve, posterior
element.origin: nasociliary nerve, from ophthalmic nerve
element.distribution: mucosa of posterior ethmoid cells and of sphenoidal sinus

element.name: infratrochlear nerve
element.origin: nasociliary nerve from ophthalmic nerve
element.distribution: skin of root and upper bridge of nose and lower eyelid, conjunctiva, lacrimal duct

element.name: tentorial nerve
element.origin: a branch that arises from the ophthalmic nerve close to its origin from the trigeminal ganglion
element.distribution: turning back to innervate the dura mater of the tentorium cerebelli and falx cerebri

element.name: vestibulocochlear nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne183.htm VESTIBULOCOCHLEAR NERVE]; acoustic nerve, auditory nerve, eighth cranial nerve, VIII
element.origin: it emerges from the brain between the pons and the medulla oblongata, at the cerebellopontine angle and behind the facial nerve
element.distribution: is connected with the brain by corresponding roots, the vestibular and the cochlear roots

element.name: cochlear nerve
element.origin: the part of the vestibulocochlear nerve concerned with hearing
element.distribution: consisting of fibers that arise from the bipolar cells in the spiral ganglion and have their receptors in the spiral organ of the cochlea

element.name: vestibular nerve
element.origin: the posterior part of the vestibulocochlear nerve, which is concerned with the sense of equilibrium
element.distribution: It consists of fibers arising from bipolar cells in the vestibular ganglion, and divides peripherally into a rostral and a caudal part, with receptors in the ampullae of the semicircular canals, the utricle, and the saccule

element.name: ampullar nerve, anterior
element.origin: the branch of the vestibular nerve
element.distribution: innervates the ampulla of the anterior semicircular duct, ending around the hair cells of the ampullary crest

element.name: ampullar nerve, lateral
element.origin: the branch of the vestibular nerve
element.distribution: innervates the ampulla of the lateral semicircular duct, ending around the hair cells of the ampullary crest

element.name: ampullar nerve, posterior
element.origin: the branch of the vestibular nerve that innervates the ampulla of the posterior semicircular duct, ending around the hair cells of the ampullary crest

element.name: saccular nerve
element.origin: the branch of the vestibular nerve
element.distribution: innervates the macula of the saccule

element.name: utricular nerve
element.origin: the branch of the vestibular nerve
element.distribution: innervates the macula of the utricle

element.name: utriculoampullary nerve
element.origin: a nerve that arises by peripheral division of the vestibular nerve
element.distribution: supplies the utricle and ampullae of the semicircular ducts

element.name: abducent nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne170.htm ABDUCENT NERVE]; sixth cranial nerve, VI
element.origin: a NUCLEUS in the pons, beneath the floor of the fourth ventricle, emerging from the brain stem anteriorly between the pons and medulla oblongata
element.distribution: lateral rectus muscle of eye

element.name: accessory nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne198.htm ACCESSORY NERVE]; eleventh cranial nerve, XI

element.name: accessory nerve, internal
element.origin: by cranial ROOTS from the side of the medulla oblongata, from the ambiguus nucleus
element.distribution: the internal branch to the vagus and thereby to the palate, pharynx, larynx, and thoracic viscera, pharyngeal and superior laryngeal branches of the vagus, muscles of the pharynx, larynx, and soft palate

element.name: accessory nerve, external
element.origin: by spinal roots from the side of the spinal cord (from the upper three or more cervical segments), from the nucleus of accessory nerve
element.distribution: the external branch branches to the sternocleidomastoid and trapezius muscles (shoulder)

element.name: hypoglossal nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne278.htm HYPOGLOSSAL NERVE]; twelfth cranial nerve, XII
element.origin: several ROOTLETS in the anterolateral sulcus between the olive and the pyramid of the medulla oblongata; it passes through the hypoglossal canal to the tongue
element.distribution: styloglossus, hyoglossus, and genioglossus muscles and intrinsic muscles of the tongue

element.name: communicating branches between the lingual nerve and hypoglossal nerve
element.distribution: forming a plexus on the hypoglossus muscle

element.name: oculomotor nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne126.htm OCULOMOTOR NERVE]; third cranial nerve, III
element.origin: BRAIN STEM, emerging medial to cerebral peduncles and running forward in the cavernous sinus
element.distribution: entering the orbit through the superior orbital fissure, the branches supply the levator muscle of upper eyelid, all extrinsic eye muscles except the lateral rectus and superior oblique, and carry parasympathetic fibers for the ciliary muscle and sphincter pupillae

element.name: oculomotor nerve, inferior branch
element.distribution: inferior rectus

element.name: oculomotor nerve, superior branch
element.distribution: supplies superior rectus and levator palpebrae superioris

element.name: ciliary nerves, short, parasympathetic fibers
element.origin: ciliary GANGLION
element.distribution: smooth muscle and tunics of eye

element.name: trochlear nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne127.htm TROCHLEAR NERVE]; fourth cranial nerve, IV
element.origin: the fibers of each trochlear nerve (one on either side) decussate across the median plane and emerge from the back of the BRAIN STEM below the corresponding inferior colliculus
element.distribution: runs forward in lateral wall of cavernous sinus, traverses the superior orbital fissure, and supplies superior oblique muscle of eyeball

element.name: facial nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne171.htm FACIAL NERVE]; seventh cranial nerve, VII
element.origin: inferior border of pons, between olive and inferior cerebellar peduncle
element.distribution: various structures of face, head, and neck
element.modality: motor, parasympathetic, general sensory, special sensory

element.name: auricular nerve, posterior
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne177.htm POSTERIOR AURICULAR NERVE]; facial nerve, occipital branch, facial nerve proper
element.origin: facial nerve
element.distribution: posterior auricular and occipitofrontal muscles and skin of external acoustic meatus

element.name: auricular nerve, posterior, auricular branch
element.distribution: supplies the auricularis posterior and the intrinsic muscles on the cranial surface of the auricula, in some mammals these muscles can adjust the direction of the pinna (outer ear); CN X sensory from ear skin

element.name: auricular nerve, posterior, occipital branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne242.htm OCCIPITAL BRANCH OF POSTERIOR AURICULAR NERVE]
element.distribution: supplies the occipitalis muscles to move the scalp

element.name: stapedius nerve
element.origin: facial nerve
element.distribution: stapedius muscle

element.name: facial nerve, marginal mandibular branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne181.htm MARGINAL MANDIBULAR BRANCHES OF FACIAL NERVE]

element.name: intermediate nerve
element.origin: the smaller root of the facial nerve, lying between the main root and the vestibulocochlear nerve; it joins the main root at, or merges with, the geniculate ganglion at the geniculum of the facial nerve
element.distribution: lacrimal, nasal, palatine, submandibular, and sublingual glands, and anterior two-thirds of tongue

element.name: chorda tympani
element.origin: branch of the facial nerve
element.distribution: parasympathetic to submandibular ganglion to submandibular, sublingual and buccal glands; supplying the submandibular and sublingual glands and the anterior two thirds of the tongue (taste)

element.name: communicating branch of chorda tympani with lingual nerve
element.origin: terminal branch of chorda tympani joining the lingual nerve in the infratemporal fossa
element.distribution: conveys sensory fibers for taste from anterior two thirds of tongue, presynaptic parasympathetic fibers destined for submandibular ganglion for innervation of submandibular and sublingual salivary glands

element.name: petrosal nerve, greater
element.origin: intermediate nerve via geniculate GANGLION
element.distribution: running forward from the geniculate ganglion, it joins the deep petrosal nerve of the pterygoid canal, and reaches lacrimal, nasal, and palatine glands and nasopharynx, via pterygopalatine ganglion and its branches

element.name: nasopalatine nerve, parasympathetic fibers
element.origin: pterygopalatine GANGLION
element.distribution: carries postganglionic parasympathetic GVE fibers to nasal and palatine glands

element.name: palatine nerve, greater, parasympathetic fibers
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne226.htm GREATER PALATINE NERVE]; palatine nerve, parasympathetic fibers, anterior
element.origin: greater petrosal nerve to pterygopalatine GANGLION
element.distribution: greater palatine PSN synapse on the hard palate and regulate mucous glands located there

element.name: palatine nerves, lesser, parasympathetic fibers
element.origin: pterygopalatine GANGLION
element.distribution: lesser palatine nerve synapses at the soft palate and controls sparse taste receptors and mucous gland, to uvula (middle palatine), to tonsils (posterior palatine), racemose glands, and some muscular fibers (musculus uvulae)

element.name: pharyngeal nerve
element.origin: a nerve running from the posterior part of the pterygopalatine GANGLION, through the pharyngeal canal with the pharyngeal branch of the maxillary artery
element.distribution: to the mucous membrane of the nasal part of the pharynx posterior to the auditory tube, pharyngeal gland

element.name: glossopharyngeal nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne186.htm GLOSSOPHARYNGEAL NERVE]; ninth cranial nerve, IX
element.origin: several ROOTLETS from lateral side of upper part of medulla oblongata, between the olive and the inferior cerebellar peduncle
element.distribution: it has two enlargements (superior and inferior ganglia) and supplies the tongue, pharynx, and parotid gland
element.modality: motor, parasympathetic, and general, special, and visceral sensory

element.name: tympanic nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne190.htm TYMPANIC BRANCH OF GLOSSOPHARYNGEAL NERVE]; Jacobson's nerve
element.origin: inferior GANGLION of glossopharyngeal nerve
element.distribution: mucous membrane of tympanic cavity, mastoid air cells, auditory tube, and, via lesser petrosal nerve and otic ganglion, the parotid gland

element.name: petrosal nerve, lesser
element.origin: tympanic PLEXUS
element.distribution: parotid GLAND via otic GANGLION and auriculotemporal nerve

element.name: glossopharyngeal nerve, stylopharyngeal branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne245.htm NERVE TO STYLOPHARYNGEUS], [http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne189.htm PHARYNGEAL BRANCHES OF GLOSSOPHARYNGEAL NERVE]
element.distribution: muscle of the pharynx, stylopharyngeus

element.name: glossopharyngeal nerve, tonsillar branch
element.distribution: supply the palatine tonsil, forming around it a plexus from which filaments are distributed to the soft palate and fauces, where they communicate with the palatine nerves, taste
element.modality: sensory fibers from palatine tonsillar fossa

element.name: glossopharyngeal nerve, lingual branch
element.distribution: one supplies the vallate papilla and the mucous membrane covering the base of the tongue; the other supplies the mucous membrane and follicular glands of the posterior part of the tongue, and communicates with the lingual nerve, innervate all the muscles of the tongue except for palatoglossus

element.name: Hering's nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne253.htm CAROTID BODY NERVE], MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne237.htm CAROTID SINUS NERVE]; glossopharyngeal nerve, branch to carotid sinus
element.distribution: innervate the carotid sinus and the carotid body, communicates with the vagus nerve and sympathetic then divides in the angle of bifurcation of the common carotid artery to supply the carotid body (chemoreceptors) and carotid sinus (baroreceptors)

element.name: vagus nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne191.htm VAGUS NERVE]; pneumogastric nerve, tenth cranial nerve, X
element.origin: by numerous ROOTLETS from lateral side of medulla oblongata in the groove between the olive and the inferior cerebellar peduncle
element.distribution: descending through the jugular foramen, it presents as a superior and an inferior ganglion, and continues through the neck and thorax into the abdomen. It supplies sensory fibers to the ear, tongue, pharynx, and larynx, motor fibers to the pharynx, larynx, and esophagus, and parasympathetic and visceral afferent fibers to thoracic and abdominal viscera
element.modality: parasympathetic, visceral afferent, motor, general sensory

element.name: recurrent laryngeal nerve
element.origin: vagus nerve (chiefly the cranial part of the accessory nerve)
element.distribution: tracheal mucosa, esophagus, cardiac plexus

element.name: inferior laryngeal nerve
element.origin: recurrent laryngeal nerve, especially the terminal portion of this nerve
element.distribution: intrinsic muscles of larynx, except cricothyroid; communicates with the internal laryngeal nerve, all muscles of larynx (EXCEPT cricothryoid)

element.name: recurrent laryngeal nerve, posterior
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne271.htm RIGHT RECURRENT LARYNGEAL NERVE]; tracheal, esophageal, and inferior cardiac branches
element.distribution: glottis, subglottis, and trachea; recurrent laryngeal nerve supplies the trachea and the esophagus with parasympathetic secretomotor innervation for glands associated with them; trachea, oesophagus and pyriform sinuses receive their sensory fibers from the posterior division of the recurrent laryngeal nerve before entering the larynx

element.name: laryngeal nerve, superior
element.origin: inferior GANGLION of vagus nerve
element.distribution: inferior constrictor of the pharynx, cricothyroid muscle, and mucous membrane of back of tongue and larynx
element.modality: motor, general sensory, visceral afferent, and parasympathetic

element.name: laryngeal nerve, external
element.origin: the smaller of the two branches into which the superior laryngeal nerve divides
element.distribution: descending under cover of the sternothyroid muscle and innervating the cricothyroid and the inferior constrictor of the pharynx

element.name: laryngeal nerve, internal
element.origin: the larger of the two branches of the superior laryngeal nerve
element.distribution: innervates the mucosa of the epiglottis, base of the tongue, and larynx; somatic: mucosae of larynx above the vocal cords, epiglottis, vallecullae; special visceral sensory: taste from the region of the valleculae

element.name: vagus nerve, auricular branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne251.htm AURICULAR BRANCH OF VAGUS NERVE]; Alderman's nerve, Arnold's nerve
element.origin: arises from the jugular ganglion, and is joined soon after its origin by a filament from the petrous ganglion of the glossopharyngeal
element.distribution: supplies sensory innervation to the skin of the ear canal

element.name: vagus nerve, meningeal branch
element.origin: recurrent filament given off from the jugular ganglion
element.distribution: dura mater in the posterior fossa of the base of the skull

element.name: vagus nerve, pharyngeal branch
element.origin: arises from the upper part of the ganglion nodosum, and consists principally of filaments from the cranial portion of the accessory nerve
element.distribution: passes across the internal carotid artery to the upper border of the Constrictor pharyngis medius, where it divides into numerous filaments, which join with branches from the glossopharyngeal, sympathetic, and external laryngeal to form the pharyngeal plexus; sensory innervates the mesopharyngeal epithelium, GSE - see accessory nerve

element.name: vagus nerve, pharyngeal plexus
element.distribution: From the plexus, branches are distributed to the muscles and mucous membrane of the pharynx and the muscles of the soft palate, except the Tensor veli palatini. A minute filament descends and joins the hypoglossal nerve as it winds around the occipital artery

element.name: vagus nerve, cardiac branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne252.htm CERVICAL CARDIAC BRANCHES OF VAGUS NERVE]
element.distribution: Sensory fibers are concerned with the reflex control of blood pressure, blood flow, and heart rate

element.name: vagus nerve, inferior cardiac branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne104.htm DEEP CARDIAC PLEXUS]; thoracic cardiac branches
element.origin: arise from the trunk of the vagus as it lies by the side of the trachea, and from its recurrent nerve
element.distribution: AV node, end in the deep part of the cardiac plexus, heart muscle, interventricular septum ganglion

element.name: vagus nerve, superior cervical cardiac branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne103.htm SUPERFICIAL CARDIAC PLEXUS]; cervical cardiac branches
element.origin: arise from the vagus, at the upper and lower parts of the neck
element.distribution: SA node, deep part of the cardiac plexus, joins the superficial part of the cardiac plexus, to cardiac ganglion of Wrisberg

element.name: vagus nerve, bronchial branch
element.distribution: distributed as 2-3 branches on the anterior surface of the root of the lung, form the anterior and posterior pulmonary plexus

element.name: vagus nerve, bronchial branch, anterior
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne194.htm ANTERIOR PULMONARY BRANCHES OF VAGUS NERVE]
element.distribution: anterior pulmonary plexus to pulmonary neuroepithelial bodies, glands in thoracic viscera, smooth muscles of the trachea and the bronchial tree

element.name: vagus nerve, bronchial branch, posterior
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne265.htm POSTERIOR PULMONARY BRANCHES OF VAGUS NERVE]
element.distribution: posterior pulmonary plexus

element.name: vagus nerve, pulmonary plexus
element.distribution: Branches from this plexus accompany the ramifications of the bronchi through the substance of the lung

element.name: vagus nerve, gastric branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne196.htm GASTRIC BRANCH OF ANTERIOR VAGUS],[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne257.htm GASTRIC BRANCH OF POSTERIOR VAGUS]
element.distribution: distributed to the stomach, right vagus forms the posterior gastric plexus on the postero-inferior surface of the stomach and the left the anterior gastric plexus on the antero-superior surface

element.name: vagus nerve, hepatic branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne258.htm HEPATIC BRANCHES OF VAGUS NERVES],[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne109.htm HEPATIC PLEXUS]
element.origin: Anterior and Posterior vagus nerves
element.distribution: join the hepatic plexus and through it are conveyed to the liver

element.name: vagus nerve, gastroduodenal branch
element.distribution: terminates in the upper duodenum, pancreas, pyloric sphincter, and antral stomach

element.name: vagus nerve, esophageal branches
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne255.htm ESOPHAGEAL PLEXUS],[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne195.htm ESOPHAGEAL BRANCHES OF VAGUS NERVE]
element.origin: formed by nerve fibers from two sources: 1.branches of the vagus nerve 2.visceral branches of the sympathetic trunk
element.distribution: supply the esophagus and also the pericardium; parasympathetic: make the anterior vagal trunk (left vagus) and the posterior vagal trunk; sympathetic: intermediolateral cell column (IMLCC) of the thoracic spinal cord, dorsal root ganglion

element.name: vagus nerve, spleen, kidney, small intestine and colon
vagus nerve, celiac branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne197.htm CELIAC BRANCH OF POSTERIOR VAGUS NERVE], [http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne107.htm CELIAC PLEXUS]
element.origin: mainly derived from the right vagus
element.distribution: join the celiac plexus and through it supply branches to the pancreas, spleen, kidneys, suprarenal bodies, and intestine; terminal branches of the posterior vagal trunk conveying presynaptic parasympathetic fibers to-and visceral afferent fibers from-the celiac plexus; provide parasympathetic innervation to the celiac plexus

element.name: vagus nerve, renal branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne269.htm RENAL BRANCHES OF VAGUS NERVES], [http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne113.htm RENAL PLEXUS]
element.distribution: The plexus follows the renal artery and is a subsidiary of the celiac plexus. It enters the splenic substance by passing into the various divisions of the artery. It supplies the renal corpuscles and tubules, together with the arteries. It gives vasomotor nerves to the renal arteries; provide parasympathetic innervation to the kidney; connection to ureteric and gonadal plexuses

element.name: C1 nerve
element.distribution: moves forward lateral to the lateral mass and medial to vertebral artery

element.name: C5 nerve
element.distribution: sensory lateral - skin after piercing the trapezius and the splenius; sensory medial - longissimus, cervicis, longissimus capitis, and iliocostalis cervicis; motor - leads into the upper trunk, then to the lateral cord, and finally to the musculocutaneous nerve

element.name: C6 nerve
element.distribution: innervating many muscles of the rotator cuff and distal arm - subclavius, supraspinatus, infraspinatus, biceps brachii, brachialis, deltoid, teres minor, brachioradialis, serratus anterior, subscapularis, pectoralis major, coracobrachialis, teres major, supinator, extensor carpi radialis brevis, extensor carpi radialis longus, latissimus dorsi

element.name: C7 nerve
element.distribution: musculocutaneous nerve, ulnar nerve, radial nerve

element.name: C8 nerve
element.distribution: skin on the little finger, slightly past the wrist on the palmar and dorsal aspects of the hand and forearm; flexion of the fingers, many mucles of trunk, upper arm, forearm, hand

element.name: suboccipital nerve
element.origin: dorsal branch of C1 nerve
element.distribution: proprioception; emerges above posterior arch of atlas and supplies muscles of suboccipital triangle and semispinal muscle of head

element.name: great auricular nerve
element.origin: cervical PLEXUS, C2/C3
element.distribution: skin over parotid gland and mastoid process, and both surfaces of auricle

element.name: great auricular nerve, anterior branch
element.distribution: face; anterior branch is sensory to facial skin over the parotid gland

element.name: great auricular nerve, posterior branch
element.distribution: ear; posterior branch supplies the skin over the mastoid process, back of the auricle, lobule and a portion of the scalp

element.name: cervical nerve, transverse
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/transversecervical.htm TRANSVERSE CERVICAL NERVE]; cutaneous nerve of neck, anterior
element.origin: cervical PLEXUS (C3)
element.distribution: skin on side and front of neck

element.name: occipital nerve, greater
element.origin: medial branch of dorsal branch of C2
element.distribution: semispinal muscle of head and skin of scalp as far forward as the vertex

element.name: occipital nerve, lesser
element.origin: superficial cervical PLEXUS (C2-C3)
element.distribution: ascends behind the auricle and supplies some of the skin on the side of the head and on the cranial surface of the auricle

element.name: occipital nerve, third
element.origin: medial branch of dorsal branch of C3
element.distribution: skin of upper part of back of neck and head

element.name: supraclavicular nerves
element.distribution: neck and upper cutaneous parts of female breast

element.name: supraclavicular nerves, intermediate
element.origin: cervical PLEXUS (C3-C4)
element.distribution: descend in the posterior triangle, cross the clavicle, and supply the skin over pectoral and deltoid region

element.name: supraclavicular nerves, lateral
element.origin: cervical PLEXUS (C3-C4)
element.distribution: descend in the posterior triangle, cross the clavicle, and supply the skin of superior and posterior parts of shoulder

element.name: supraclavicular nerves, medial
element.origin: cervical PLEXUS (C3-C4)
element.distribution: descend in posterior triangle, cross the clavicle, and supply the skin of medial infraclavicular region

element.name: jugular nerve, sensory
element.origin: a branch of the superior cervical GANGLION
element.distribution: communicates with the vagus and glossopharyngeal nerves; jugular nerve, passes upward to the base of the skull, and divides to join the petrous ganglion of the glossopharyngeal, and the jugular ganglion of the vagus

element.name: jugular nerve, branch to petrosal (inferior glossopharyngeal) ganglion
jugular nerve, branch to jugular (superior vagal) ganglion
axillary nerve
element.origin: posterior cord of brachial PLEXUS (C5-C6)
element.distribution: deltoid and teres minor muscles, skin on back of arm

element.name: cutaneous nerve of arm, posterior
element.origin: radial nerve in the axilla
element.distribution: skin on back of arm

element.name: cutaneous nerve of arm, superior lateral
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne6.htm UPPER LATERAL CUTANEOUS NERVE OF ARM]
element.origin: axillary nerve
element.distribution: skin of back of arm

element.name: cutaneous nerve of arm, medial
element.origin: medial cord of brachial PLEXUS (T1)
element.distribution: skin on medial and posterior aspects of arm

element.name: long thoracic nerve
element.origin: brachial PLEXUS (ventral branches of C5-C7)
element.distribution: descends behind brachial plexus to serratus anterior muscle

element.name: suprascapular nerve
element.origin: brachial PLEXUS (C5-C6)
element.distribution: descends through suprascapular and spinoglenoid notches and supplies acromioclavicular and shoulder joints, and supraspinous and infraspinous muscles

element.name: dorsal scapular nerve
element.origin: brachial PLEXUS-ventral branch of C5
element.distribution: rhomboid muscles and occasionally the levator muscle of scapula

element.name: thoracodorsal nerve
element.origin: posterior cord of brachial PLEXUS (C7-C8)
element.distribution: latissimus dorsi muscle

element.name: subclavian nerve
element.origin: upper trunk of brachial PLEXUS (C5)
element.distribution: subclavius muscle and sternoclavicular joint

element.name: cutaneous nerve of forearm, medial
element.origin: medial cord of brachial PLEXUS (C8, T1)
element.distribution: skin of front, medial, and posteromedial aspects of forearm

element.name: musculocutaneous nerve
element.origin: lateral cord of brachial PLEXUS-C5-C7
element.distribution: coracobrachial and biceps brachial muscles, the elbow joint, and skin of radial side of forearm

element.name: cutaneous nerve of forearm, lateral
element.origin: continuation of musculocutaneous nerve
element.distribution: skin over radial side of forearm and sometimes an area of skin of dorsum of hand

element.name: ulnar nerve
element.origin: medial and lateral cords of brachial PLEXUS (C7-T1)
element.distribution: ultimately to skin on front and back of medial part of hand, some flexor muscles on front of forearm, many short muscles of hand, elbow joint, many joints of hand

element.name: ulnar nerve, palmar cutaneous branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne18.htm PALMAR CUTANEOUS BRANCH OF ULNAR NERVE]

element.name: digital nerves of ulnar nerve, dorsal
element.origin: dorsal branch of ulnar nerve
element.distribution: skin and joints of medial side of little finger, dorsal aspects of adjacent sides of little and ring fingers and of ring and middle fingers

element.name: digital nerves of ulnar nerve, common palmar number two
element.origin: superficial branch of ulnar nerve
element.distribution: little and ring fingers

element.name: digital nerves of ulnar nerve, proper palmar
element.synonyms: proper palmar digital nerves of ulnar nerve
element.origin: the lateral of the two common palmar digital nerves from the superficial branch of the ulnar nerve
element.distribution: skin and joints of adjacent sides of fourth and fifth fingers

element.name: median nerve
element.origin: lateral and medial cords of brachial PLEXUS-C6-T1
element.distribution: ultimately, skin on front of lateral part of hand, most of flexor muscles of front of forearm, most of short muscles of thumb and elbow joint, and many joints of hand

element.name: median nerve, palmar cutaneous branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne204.htm PALMAR CUTANEOUS BRANCH OF MEDIAN NERVE]

element.name: median nerve, palmar digital branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne205.htm - PALMAR DIGITAL BRANCHES OF MEDIAN NERVE]

element.name: digital nerves of median nerve, common palmar number four
element.origin: lateral and medial divisions of median nerve
element.distribution: thumb, index, middle, and ring fingers, and first two lumbrical muscles

element.name: digital nerves of median nerve, proper palmar
element.origin: common palmar digital nerves
element.distribution: first two lumbrical muscles, skin and joints of both sides and palmar aspect of thumb, index, and middle fingers, radial side of ring finger, and back of distal aspect of these digits

element.name: interosseous nerve of forearm, anterior
element.origin: median nerve
element.distribution: long flexor of thumb, deep flexor of fingers, and pronator quadratus muscles, wrist and intercarpal joints

element.name: radial nerve
element.origin: posterior cord of brachial PLEXUS (C6-C8, and sometimes C5 and T1)
element.distribution: descending in the back of arm and forearm, it is ultimately distributed to skin on back of arm, forearm, and hand, extensor muscles on back of arm and forearm, and elbow joint and many joints of hand

element.name: cutaneous nerve of arm, inferior lateral
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne7.htm LOWER LATERAL CUTANEOUS NERVE OF ARM]
element.origin: radial nerve
element.distribution: skin of lateral surface of lower part of arm

element.name: cutaneous nerve of forearm, posterior
element.origin: radial nerve
element.distribution: skin of dorsal aspect of forearm

element.name: digital nerves of radial nerve, dorsal
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne206.htm DORSAL DIGITAL BRANCHES OF SUPERFICIAL RADIAL NERVE]
element.origin: superficial branch of radial nerve
element.distribution: skin and joints of back of thumb, index finger, and part of middle finger, as far distally as the distal phalanx

element.name: interosseous nerve of forearm, posterior
element.origin: continuation of deep branch of radial nerve
element.distribution: long abductor muscle of thumb, extensor muscles of the thumb and second finger, and wrist and intercarpal joints

element.name: Motor and Sensory (Ventral Spinal Roots and Dorsal Spinal Roots)
phrenic nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/leftphrenicnerve.htm LEFT PHRENIC NERVE], [http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/rightphrenicnerve.htm RIGHT PHRENIC NERVE]
element.origin: cervical PLEXUS (C3-C5)
element.distribution: pleura, pericardium, diaphragm, peritoneum, and sympathetic plexuses; sensory - central tendon of the diaphragm

element.name: phrenic nerves, accessory
element.origin: an inconstant contribution of the fifth cervical nerve to the phrenic nerve; when present, they run a separate course to the root of the neck or into the thorax before joining the phrenic nerve

element.name: cervical cardiac nerve, middle, sensory
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne303.htm LEFT CARDIAC BRANCH OF MIDDLE CERVICAL GANGLION], [http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne314.htm RIGHT CARDIAC BRANCH OF MIDDLE CERVICAL GANGLION]
element.origin: sensory fibers whose cell bodies are placed in the C5-6 spinal ganglia through the thoracic splanchnic nerves

element.name: cervical cardiac nerve, inferior, sensory
element.origin: sensory fibers whose cell bodies are placed in the C7-8,T1 spinal ganglia through the thoracic splanchnic nerves
element.distribution: heart via cardiac PLEXUS

element.name: grey communicating rami
element.origin: spinal cord
element.distribution: C1-C4 spinal nerve targets

element.name: jugular nerve, sympathetic
element.origin: a branch of the superior cervical GANGLION
element.distribution: sympathetic vasomotor - to blood vessels

element.name: superior cervical cardiac nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne302.htm LEFT CARDIAC BRANCH OF SUPERIOR CERVICAL GANGLION], [http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne313.htm RIGHT CARDIAC BRANCH OF SUPERIOR CERVICAL GANGLION]

element.name: caroticotympanic nerves
element.synonyms: MA[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne293.htm INFERIOR CAROTICOTYMPANIC NERVE], [http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne317.htm SUPERIOR CAROTICOTYMPANIC NERVE]
element.origin: internal carotid PLEXUS; inferior and superior nerves can be distinguished; together with tympanic nerve, they form the tympanic plexus
element.distribution: tympanic region and parotid gland

element.name: ciliary nerves, sympathetic fibers
element.origin: nasociliary nerve, from ophthalmic nerve
element.distribution: long and short ciliary nerves, dilator muscle of pupil, uvea, cornea

element.name: petrosal nerve, deep
element.synonyms: MA[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne233.htm EXTERNAL PETROSAL NERVE], MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne173.htm DEEP PETROSAL NERVE]; vidian nerve, deep
element.origin: internal carotid PLEXUS from T1 spinal nerve
element.distribution: from superior cervical sympathetic ganglion as internal carotid nerve, joins greater petrosal nerve to form nerve of pterygoid canal, and supplies lacrimal, nasal, and palatine glands via pterygopalatine ganglion and its branches

element.name: palatine nerve, sympathetic fibers
element.distribution: superior cervical ganglion sends sympathetic nerve fibers to the head organs, sympathetic fibers from the SCG run up on the internal carotid artery and form the deep petrosal nerve to pterygopalatine ganglia and follow the same tracts as the parasympathetic fibers

element.name: palatine nerve, sympathetic fibers, greater
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne149.htm POSTERIOR INFERIOR NASAL NERVES]; palatine nerve, sympathetic fibers, anterior
element.origin: deep petrosal nerve to pterygopalatine GANGLION
element.distribution: hard palate, mucous glands

element.name: palatine nerves, sympathetic fibers, lesser
element.origin: pterygopalatine GANGLION
element.distribution: lesser palatine nerve synapses at the soft palate and controls sparse taste receptors and mucous gland

element.name: external carotid nerve
element.distribution: ramify upon the common carotid artery and upon the external carotid artery and its branches; w/o connection in submaxillary ganglion, otic ganglion, external petrosal nerve, to the genicular ganglion of the facial nerve

element.name: laryngopharyngeal branches
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne300.htm LARYNGOPHARYNGEAL BRANCHES OF SUPERIOR CERVICAL GANGLION]
element.distribution: pass to the side of the pharynx, where they join with branches from the glossopharyngeal, vagus, and external laryngeal nerves to form the pharyngeal plexus

element.name: grey communicating rami
element.origin: spinal cord
element.distribution: C5-C6 spinal nerve targets, inner surface of hands

element.name: cervical cardiac nerve, middle, sympathetic
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne303.htm LEFT CARDIAC BRANCH OF MIDDLE CERVICAL GANGLION], [http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne314.htm RIGHT CARDIAC BRANCH OF MIDDLE CERVICAL GANGLION]
element.origin: middle cervical GANGLION

element.name: middle cervical ganglion, thyroid branches
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne325.htm THYROID BRANCHES OF MIDDLE CERVICAL GANGLION]

element.name: ansa subclavia
element.distribution: to stellate ganglion

element.name: stellate ganglion, sympathetic fibers
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne316.htm CERVICOTHORACIC GANGLION]; inferior cervical ganglion, cervicothoracic ganglion

element.name: grey communicating rami
element.origin: spinal cord
element.distribution: C7-C8 spinal nerve targets, outer surface of hands

element.name: cervical cardiac nerve, inferior, sympathetic
element.origin: cervicothoracic GANGLION
element.distribution: heart via cardiac PLEXUS

element.name: stellate ganglion, arterial branches
element.distribution: supply the subclavian and vertebral arteries

element.name: intercostal nerves
element.origin: arise from anterior divisions (rami anteriores; ventral divisions) of the thoracic spinal nerves from T1 to T11

element.name: intercostal nerves, posterior lateral cutaneous branches
element.distribution: run backward, and supply the skin over the scapula and Latissimus dorsi.run forward the side two way side of the muscular supply

element.name: intercostal nerves, anterior lateral cutaneous branches
element.distribution: run forward to the side and the forepart of the chest, supplying the skin and the mamma; those of the fifth and sixth nerves supply the upper digitations of the Obliquus externus abdominis

element.name: intercostal nerves, anterior cutaneous branches
element.distribution: run forward to the side and the forepart of the chest, supplying the skin and the mamma; those of the fifth and sixth nerves supply the upper digitations of the Obliquus externus abdominis

element.name: intercostobrachial nerve
element.origin: T2-T3, lateral cutaneous branch of the 2nd intercostal nerve
element.distribution: two nerves arising from the intercostal nerves and supplying the skin of the upper limb

element.name: first intercostobrachial nerve
element.origin: second intercostal nerve
element.distribution: skin on back and medial aspect of arm

element.name: second intercostobrachial nerve
element.origin: third intercostal nerve
element.distribution: skin of axilla and medial aspect of arm, supplies breast areola

element.name: 4th intercostal nerve
element.distribution: supplies breast nipple, areola

element.name: 5th intercostal nerve
element.distribution: supplies breast areola

element.name: 6th intercostal nerve
element.distribution: musculus obliquus abdominis externus

element.name: 7th intercostal nerve
element.distribution: musculus obliquus abdominis externus, musculus transversus abdominis

element.name: 8th intercostal nerve
element.distribution: musculus obliquus abdominis externus, musculus obliquus abdominis internus, musculus transversus abdominis

element.name: 9th intercostal nerve
element.distribution: musculus obliquus abdominis externus, musculus obliquus abdominis internus, musculus transversus abdominis

element.name: 10th intercostal nerve
element.distribution: musculus obliquus abdominis externus, musculus obliquus abdominis internus, musculus transversus abdominis

element.name: 11th intercostal nerve
element.distribution: musculus obliquus abdominis externus, musculus obliquus abdominis internus, musculus transversus abdominis

element.name: subcostal nerve, sensory
element.origin: anterior branch of twelfth thoracic nerve
element.distribution: skin of lower abdomen and lateral side of gluteal region, parts of abdominal transverse, oblique, and rectus muscles, and usually the pyramidal muscle, and adjacent peritoneum, musculus quadratus lumborum

element.name: intercostal nerves, sympathetic fibers
element.origin: gray rami communicants
element.distribution: muscles, vasomotor thoracic nerves to mammary gland T1-T5

element.name: thoracic sympatetic fibers, meningeal branches
element.distribution: spinal minengles and perivascular plexuses

element.name: greater thoracic splanchnic nerve
element.origin: thoracic sympathetic trunk and fifth through tenth thoracic GANGLIA
element.distribution: descending through the diaphragm or its aortic openings, ends in celiac ganglia and plexuses, with a splanchnic ganglion commonly occurring near the diaphragm

element.name: lowest splanchnic nerve
element.origin: T12,last GANGLION of sympathetic trunk or lesser splanchnic nerve
element.distribution: T12, aorticorenal ganglion and adjacent plexus

element.name: lesser splanchnic nerve
element.origin: T9-T11 GANGLIA of sympathetic trunk
element.distribution: pierces the diaphragm, joins the aorticorenal ganglion and celiac plexus, and communicates with the renal and superior mesenteric plexuses
